other_tests.findings: Evidence of a chronic proximal myopathy with inflammatory features.
Mildly increased variation in fiber size and occasional degenerating fibers, myonecrosis, vascular injury, and fibrosis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A repeat muscle-biopsy specimen showed subtle changes of an inflammatory myopathy with minimal endomysial inflammation, and mild atrophy of type 2 fibers.

other_tests.date: 4 months after the initial muscle biopsy
other_tests.findings: Deep dermal ischemic damage with eccrine gland necrosis, features consistent with Degos’s disease.

other_tests.date: 5 weeks after the first muscle biopsy
other_tests.findings: Focal endomysial chronic inflammation with capillary labeling for C5b–C9.
Focal mucosal damage with disruption of crypt architecture, apoptosis, and focal denudation of surface epithelium, findings consistent with ischemic colitis.
